Description: Handle-plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of bird (only head missing; with added red on wings) to right; glazed black on underside, on handle and around the edges.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the decoration, see Alexandria 17025.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 203, no. N1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.188) (phase 3)
